# MCP Registry Submission Guide

## üéâ Package Published to PyPI!
‚úÖ **discrete-structures-mcp v0.1.0** is now live at:
https://pypi.org/project/discrete-structures-mcp/

## üìù Registry Submission Checklist

### 1. GitHub MCP Registry (Official)
**Status:** Primary submission target

#### Method A: GitHub Issue (Recommended)
1. Visit: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/issues/new
2. Title: `Add discrete-structures-mcp server`
3. Body Template:
```markdown
## Server Submission: discrete-structures-mcp

### Package Information
- **Name:** discrete-structures-mcp
- **Version:** 0.1.0
- **PyPI:** https://pypi.org/project/discrete-structures-mcp/
- **GitHub:** https://github.com/ZohaibCodez/discrete-structures-ai-platform
- **License:** MIT

### Description
MCP server for Discrete Structures education providing 21 tools across four domains:
- Logic: Boolean algebra, truth tables, CNF/DNF conversion (5 tools)
- Algorithms: Sorting and graph algorithm visualizations (6 tools)
- Number Theory: Prime numbers, GCD/LCM, modular arithmetic (5 tools)
- Cryptography: Classical and modern encryption techniques (5 tools)

### Installation
```bash
uvx discrete-structures-mcp
```

### Usage with Claude Desktop
```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "discrete-structures": {
      "command": "uvx",
      "args": ["discrete-structures-mcp"]
    }
  }
}
```

### Categories
- Education
- Mathematics
- Computer Science
- Algorithms
- Cryptography

### Tags
`logic`, `algorithms`, `cryptography`, `number-theory`, `discrete-math`, `education`, `mathematics`
```

#### Method B: Direct Registry Submission
Check for registry submission form at: https://registry.modelcontextprotocol.io/

---

### 2. Smithery (Community Registry)
**URL:** https://smithery.ai/
**Status:** Open submission

#### Steps:
1. Visit https://smithery.ai/submit or https://smithery.ai/publish
2. Enter package details:
   - **Package Name:** discrete-structures-mcp
   - **Install Command:** `uvx discrete-structures-mcp`
   - **Description:** MCP server for Discrete Structures - Logic, Algorithms, Number Theory, and Cryptography tools
   - **Category:** Education, Development Tools
   - **GitHub:** https://github.com/ZohaibCodez/discrete-structures-ai-platform
   - **Tags:** logic, algorithms, cryptography, number-theory, education, mathematics

3. Upload logo/icon (optional):
   - Use a 256x256 PNG image representing discrete structures (graph, logic gates, etc.)

---

### 3. MCPHub
**URL:** https://www.mcphub.com/
**Status:** Community directory with reviews

#### Steps:
1. Visit https://www.mcphub.com/submit
2. Fill out server information:
   - **Server Name:** Discrete Structures
   - **Package:** discrete-structures-mcp
   - **Version:** 0.1.0
   - **Install:** `uvx discrete-structures-mcp`
   - **Description:** Educational MCP server with 21 tools for discrete mathematics
   - **Categories:** Education, Mathematics, Computer Science
   - **PyPI Link:** https://pypi.org/project/discrete-structures-mcp/
   - **Repository:** https://github.com/ZohaibCodez/discrete-structures-ai-platform

3. Optional: Add screenshots/demo video

---

### 4. mcp.run
**URL:** https://mcp.run/
**Status:** Hosted registry

#### Steps:
1. Visit https://mcp.run/submit or https://mcp.run/registry
2. Register server:
   - **Name:** discrete-structures-mcp
   - **Type:** Python/PyPI
   - **Install:** `uvx discrete-structures-mcp`
   - **Repository:** https://github.com/ZohaibCodez/discrete-structures-ai-platform
   - **Description:** 21 discrete structures tools for education
   - **Keywords:** logic, algorithms, cryptography, number-theory

---

### 5. PulseMCP
**URL:** https://www.pulsemcp.com/
**Status:** Community hub & newsletter

#### Steps:
1. Visit https://www.pulsemcp.com/submit
2. Submit server details via form or email to: hello@pulsemcp.com
3. Include:
   - Server name: discrete-structures-mcp
   - PyPI link: https://pypi.org/project/discrete-structures-mcp/
   - Short pitch: "Educational MCP server with 21 tools across logic, algorithms, number theory, and cryptography"
   - Target audience: Students, educators, AI developers

---

## üîÑ Maintenance

### Version Updates
When releasing v0.2.0:
1. Update all registry listings
2. Rebuild and republish to PyPI
3. Announce in communities
4. Update documentation

### Monitoring
- Watch PyPI download stats
- Monitor GitHub issues/discussions
- Track registry listing views
- Collect user feedback
